description: We are seeking a skilled developer to create a web and API solution that integrates seamlessly with our existing database and third-party software. The ideal candidate will have experience with API design, database management, and web development frameworks. Your role will include gathering requirements, developing the solution, and ensuring compatibility with various software systems. Strong problem-solving abilities and attention to detail are essential for this project.
title: Web and API Development for Database Integration

description: We are implementing a new to us software for accounting and project management. We're moving from SAGE (X3) to Acumatica. We are looking for assistance and guidance to reduce the learning time and to effectively implement some learned best practices from someone who has experience with the Acumatica platform and can help guide us. The focus will be on all modules including the Accounting (AP and AR), Project Operations & Project Management. Our office is in Alpharetta, GA. While in-person is not critical, ideally we were able to find a partner that was close enough to at least spend some time with us in person as we develop and implement the Acumatica software and associated processes.
title: Acumatica Onboarding Assistance

description: This SaaS was built using a platform called "ConcreteCMS." It is a relatively rare content management system, and the client wants to maintain consistency with a specific theme they like. Therefore, the new layout needs to be aligned with this theme. A Figma design alone will not suffice, the client also requires an HTML version, which will likely need to be converted into "ConcreteCMS" blocks to build the layout within that system. It requires someone with expertise in that specific CMS and significant frontend experience, particularly with JavaScript, HTML, and CSS. Customizing a specific theme for a rare CMS.
title: UI/UX for Concrete CMS

description: We are a small building services company seeking a reliable, experienced bookkeeper to help organize and manage our financial records. Our primary focus is keeping accounts receivable (AR) and accounts payable (AP) up to date, ensuring accuracy in reconciliations, and working collaboratively with our current accountant. Responsibilities: - Perform AR and AP reconciliations. - Manage invoicing, billing, and follow-ups with clients as needed. - Maintain detailed records of transactions and ensure accounts are accurate. - Generate financial reports and summaries based on requirements. - Work closely with our accountant to ensure all financial data is aligned. - Proactively self-manage tasks and deadlines, providing updates when needed. Requirements: - Proven experience in bookkeeping, particularly with AR and AP management. - Proficiency in accounting software (e.g., QuickBooks, Xero, or similar). - Strong understanding of bookkeeping best practices and financial reporting. - Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail. - Ability to work independently and communicate effectively. - Familiarity with building services or similar industries is a plus but not required. Scope: The bookkeeping position is part-time with flexible hours, but it will require consistent communications and updates. The ideal candidate will help establish order and ongoing support of financial operations as needed. How to apply: Please submit a proposal with the following: 1. A brief overview of your experience with bookkeeping and AR/AP management. 2. The accounting software you are most comfortable using. 3. Examples of similar projects you've completed (if available). 4. Your availability and hourly rate. We are looking for someone detail-oriented, dependable, and proactive. If this sounds like you, we would love to hear from you! Happy Holidays!
title: Experienced Bookkeeper for Building Services Company

description: Spatial Surgical is developing a next generation robotic surgical system and needs an electrical/electroinc engineer to lead the whole project. The project includes a laser, multiple cameras, various tracking technologies, and 3D software enhancements.
title: Electrical/Electronic Project Manager

description: We are seeking a skilled AppFolio consultant who can also serve as an in-person bookkeeper and manage accounts payables and receivables. The ideal candidate should have a solid understanding of AppFolio software and possess strong bookkeeping skills to ensure accurate financial reporting. If you are experienced in property management accounting and enjoy working closely with clients, we would love to hear from you! Relevant Skills: - AppFolio expertise - Bookkeeping - Accounts Payable Management - Accounts Receivable Management - Financial Reporting - Attention to Detail - Communication Skills
title: AppFolio Consultant & In-Person Bookkeeper Needed

description: Labor Category: Specialist 3 Work Location: Primary location: 1 Centre St, New York, NY 10007 Secondary Location: Various DCAS 55 buildings where work is required or Needed Projected Assignment Start Date: January 1, 2025 Projected Assignment End Date: August 7, 2026 IT Consultant for Network Infrastructure Job Description Justification: Our Client Network Infrastructure and Telecommunication team in NYC provides for the sustained, efficient, and effective delivery of network infrastructure, and telecommunications to enhance service delivery to the employees, and partners. The team manages a highly complex network and telecommunication at Central office, 1 Centre Street and 55+ Satellite sites throughout the five boroughs and manages/supports network for over 3000 employees. The team is in the process of refreshing the infrastructure with modern hardware and solutions at its satellite sites. The team will be required to perform fieldwork, visiting the various DCAS-managed buildings to replace the hardware, where necessary. The team must work at 40+ sites replacing close to 150 networks hardware and connections. (Please see Exhibit A for DCAS 40+ sites.) These sites house our client’s staff who support NYS Courts, borough halls and other city agencies. Currently the network hardware at these satellite sites are over 10 years old and End of Life (EoL). Along with this, the software support has expired for these devices, and they are susceptible to vulnerabilities. A downtime on these devices will block communication to these sites and will have operational impacts such as building maintenance, building engineering support and reachability to DCAS Police desks at these locations. With the existing IT Network resources and infrastructure response team, who are the first point of contact for issues impacting various business partners, our client will fall short of balanced day-to-day operation and site upgrade tasks. SCOPE OF SERVICES The consultant will be performing highly technical responsibilities at varying levels of difficulty and with varying degrees of latitude for independent initiative and judgment. Responsibilities will not be limited to upgrading the network infrastructure at our client’s various sites but taking charge on the day-to-day network and telecommunication issues, which involve critical thinking and problem solving in concert with the utilization of industry standard best practices. Scheduled Work Hours: Normal business hours Monday-Friday 35 hours/week (not including mandatory unpaid meal break after 6 hours of work). Days/hours of the week will change if after hour/weekend work is scheduled for the upgrade and deployment. (Weekly hours will be adjusted accordingly) TASKS: • Work with Network infrastructure and Telecommunication team leader for upgrading network, implementing wireless solution (Meraki & Cisco) and their support/troubleshooting. • Work on Cisco Catalyst, Nexus switches and Cisco VoIP devices. • Implement protocols such as: EIGRP, BGP SSH, TCP/IP, UDP, SSL, HTTP, HTTPS, DNS, routing protocols, L2/L3 switches, VPC, 802.1Q, ether-channel, STP, RSTP, VTP, QoS, ACLs, FTP, DNS, SIP and other common protocols. • Implement security products firewalls, IPSec, RADIUS, PKI, IKE, Certificates, 802.1Q, MD5, SSH, SSL, SHA1. • Data gathering of land line at various DCAS buildings where VoIP will be deployed. • Design of the LAN considering legacy equipment integration/upgrade needs. Upgrading might include patching from patch panel to network device. • Consultant will be managing the deployment process as follows: • Unpack the equipment and perform an initial inventory of each item, ensuring that all components are accounted for before beginning the installation. • Rack all equipment at each site. • Remove debris from each location. • Connect power cords to switch and power outlet and confirm power to unit. • Connect cables as per Vendor spreadsheet for all network devices. • Document the equipment onto an inventory spreadsheet. • Provide documentation via inventory spreadsheet. • Import asset to DCAS asset inventory system. • Design recommendations based on CISCO best practice methodology. • Project planning for the implementation, maintenance window. • Consultant must be willing to travel to various DCAS buildings across 5 boroughs for data gathering, network deployment and troubleshooting. • Tasks may include network management, monitoring and troubleshooting tools (sniffer, syslog, NetFlow, TCPDUMP, Wireshark). • Day to Day configuration, management, and operations of Cisco Firepower firewalls, ISE, Stealthwatch and DNAC. • Use Cisco Command line interface, Windows, OSX and Linux • In certain instances, consultant may be asked to assist in troubleshooting beyond the normal work hours. • Expected to document networks, network systems, MOPs and other documents that can be used as operational materials. • Conduct network and security assessments to troubleshoot and optimize network performance and design. Support and lead efforts of the design, testing, evaluation and implementation of new architectures and technologies. The team will be required to perform fieldwork, visiting the various DCAS-managed buildings to replace the hardware and address issues, where necessary. MANDATORY SKILLS/EXPERIENCE Note: Candidates who do not have the mandatory skills will not be considered • At least 12 years of experience in an IT network engineering/ Technician role • Must demonstrate strong understanding complex Routing & Switching Environments • Must possess strong experience with Meraki, Firewalls, DNA and ISE • Ability to work independently is critical. • Some amount of physical work expected for installation and cabling. • Experience in implementing network patches. • Strong troubleshooting and problem-solving skills. • Position is client facing. Strong Customer Support and interpersonal skills are required. DESIRABLE SKILLS/EXPERIENCE: N/A • Cisco WLAN and ISE specific experience desired • Understanding of Meraki Wi-Fi deployment, VPN Certificates and wireless routers • Working knowledge of ITL processes, specifically Incident Management, Change Management, Problem Management • Active CCNA certification preferred.
title: Network Infrastructure Engineer

description: We are seeking a motivated Client Acquisition Specialist to help drive growth for our custom software consulting firm. The ideal candidate will have experience in sales, specifically in the tech sector, and possess the ability to identify and engage potential clients. Your role will involve researching prospects, reaching out via email and calls, and setting up meetings to showcase our software solutions. If you are passionate about technology and have a knack for building relationships, we want to hear from you! Commissions will also be paid out on closed accounts
title: Client Acquisition Specialist for Software Consulting Business

description: Description: My wife and I seek an experienced Kitchen and Bath Interior Designer to help us create a cohesive and functional design for our upcoming renovation. This project focuses on a like-for-like remodel of three spaces: the kitchen (including a dining area), master bathroom, and guest bathroom. Our goal is to refresh these areas with updated finishes and fixtures while reusing existing elements where possible, all in a transitional modern style that reflects our preferences as a couple in our mid-40s to mid-50s. We need clear documentation and detailed plans to provide to contractors for seamless execution, as well as an item inventory list to streamline the renovation process. Scope of Work: Primary Bathroom (16x11 ft): Walk-in shower Soaking tub 12-ft vanity with double sinks Toilet room Kitchen (with Dining Area): Reusing current cabinetry (with potential refinishing or repainting options) Updating countertops, flooring, backsplash, and fixtures Guest Bathroom (3-piece): Bathtub, vanity, and toilet Incorporate the existing bathtub into the updated design Deliverables: Detailed Floor Plans: Precise layouts for each space, showing the placement of fixtures, cabinets, and other elements. 3D Renderings: Realistic visualizations of the updated kitchen, primary bathroom, and guest bathroom to illustrate the final design. Material and Fixture Recommendations: Suggestions for flooring, tile, countertops, hardware, and paint. Recommendations for cost-effective options to match the transitional modern aesthetic. Lighting Plan: Recommendations for task, ambient, and decorative lighting to enhance each space. Contractor-Ready Schematics: Professional-grade documentation with clear instructions and measurements for tradespeople to follow. Item Inventory List: Comprehensive list of all ordered materials, fixtures, and finishes. Details of delivery dates, quantities, and where each item should be used in the renovation. Installation Notes: Highlight special installation instructions (e.g., tile patterns, grout colors, or edge details). Budget-Friendly Alternatives: Include cost-saving suggestions for materials or design changes to help stay within budget while maintaining the desired aesthetic. Maintenance-Friendly Suggestions: Since this is a renovation project for a busy household, recommend durable and easy-to-maintain materials and finishes. Timeline Expectations: Preferred Timeline for Deliverables: Complete the first draft and final designs by 12/27. Incentive: We are open to offering a bonus for delivering high-quality work ahead of schedule if the timeline is met without compromising quality. What We’re Looking For: Designers with proven experience in kitchen and bath projects, particularly in the transitional modern style. Expertise in creating contractor-ready documents (e.g., layouts, schematics, and detailed plans). Creative ideas for incorporating existing elements like cabinetry and bathtubs into a refreshed design. Proficiency in design tools such as AutoCAD, SketchUp, or similar software. Working efficiently with provided photos, measurements, and minimal revisions. What We Do NOT Need: Space planning or structural changes (this is a like-for-like remodel). Mood boards or elaborate design presentations. Assistance with shopping or project management during the construction phase. Submission Requirements: If you’re interested in this project, please provide the following: Examples of similar projects you’ve completed. An estimated timeline for completing the designs and deliverables. A brief overview of your experience with kitchen and bathroom remodels. We’re excited to begin this project and look forward to collaborating with the right designer to transform our kitchen and bathrooms into beautiful, functional spaces. Let us know how you can help! Thank you!
title: Kitchen and Bath Interior Designer Needed for Renovation Project

description: Job Post: Seeking a Skilled Multifamily Asset Manager to Review, Edit, and Enhance Operational Checklists & Manuals We are in search of a Multifamily Asset Manager with extensive experience in managing Class A multifamily properties to assist in refining and optimizing comprehensive operational tools for a 300-unit property. The role involves reviewing, editing, and suggesting changes to existing daily, weekly, and monthly checklists for various positions within the property management team, as well as enhancing a thorough manual on task completion. Project Scope: Deliverables include reviewed and updated checklists for all roles, a refined regional management review checklist, and an enhanced step-by-step manual for completing all tasks. This is a freelance, remote position with flexibility to collaborate across time zones. If you have the skills and experience to streamline operations and elevate property management tools, we would love to hear from you!
title: Skilled Multifamily Asset Manager to Review, Edit, and Enhance Operational Checklists & Manuals

description: HIPAA Compliance and Strategy Consultant Needed for SBIR Grant Proposal Job Description: We seek an experienced HIPAA Compliance Consultant for an SBIR application to the National Cancer Institute (NCI). Background: We are developing innovative new artificial intelligence (AI) software that automatically detects cancer from endoscopic ultrasound images. The software will be designed for early detection of cancer, and supports decision making by the physician. We submitted an application to the NIH in Sept 2024, where it received a strong score just outside of funding range. One of the reviewers suggested we add a HIPAA consultant to better understand regulatory compliance related to the software. Objective: You will review our application and provide input from a compliance regulatory perspective, including HIPAA. This will probably be a few hours of effort, to comment on our application which is being rebusmitted in Jan 5 , 2025. If the grant is funded, you will also have an opportunity to be part of the project, providing consultative input. About: Our software facilitates the secure exchange of patient data from image software to interface with physician, and is designed for use by endoscopist providers in the United States. We require guidance on privacy, security, and risk management requirements, along with support in documentation and audits. Key Responsibilities Grant Pre-Award: * Conduct a thorough assessment of our software for HIPAA compliance. * Provide an NIH style biosketch to award * Sit in on a few meetings to understand regulatory issues with the proposal * Review, edit, and/or comment on the proposal from regulatory perspective Post Award (If Funded): * Develop and document policies and procedures to meet HIPAA Privacy and Security Rule requirements. * Advise on implementing administrative, physical, and technical safeguards. * Assist in conducting a risk assessment and creating a risk management plan. * Provide training and education materials for our team to ensure ongoing compliance. * Offer support for any potential HIPAA audits or inquiries. Qualifications: * Proven experience in HIPAA compliance consulting. * Strong knowledge of HIPAA Privacy, Security, and Breach Notification Rules. * Experience working with healthcare software or technology companies. * Excellent communication and documentation skills. * Ability to work collaboratively with software developers, legal teams, and management. Preferred: * Certifications such as CHPC (Certified in Healthcare Privacy Compliance) or CIPP/US. * Experience with other healthcare compliance frameworks (e.g., HITECH, GDPR). * Prior NIH grants, SBIRs, STTRs, R grants * Publications accessible via PubMed Project Details: * Pre-Award: Now until Jan 5, 2025 * Post-Award: May 2025 and beyond Please submit: * Your resume, or bio * Your NIH style biosketch * Prior grants you have been involved with * Prior projects related to this one * Experience in developing decision support software, and/or AI that interacts with clinicians
title: HIPAA Consultant for NIH SBIR submission - Imaging Decision Support

description: We are seeking an experienced CRM migration specialist to assist with the migration of our current system from Blackbaud RE to GiveSmart. description: We are seeking a skilled and knowledgeable Technical Content Writer to create high-quality articles focused on tech products and software. The ideal candidate should have a strong understanding of technology, excellent research skills, and the ability to present technical information in a clear, engaging, and concise manner. First Project Details: - Topic: Tech products or software (specific topic will be provided). - Word Count: 300-500 words. - Budget: $50 for this initial article. - Potential for More Work: If this project is successful, there will be ongoing opportunities to work on additional articles and content. Responsibilities: - Conduct thorough research on assigned topics. - Write clear, accurate, and engaging content. - Ensure content is free from grammatical errors and adheres to the provided guidelines. - Deliver content on time. Requirements: - Proven experience in writing technical content (please share samples). - Strong understanding of tech products and software. - Ability to simplify complex technical concepts for a general audience. - Excellent grammar and attention to detail. If you're passionate about technology and have a talent for crafting compelling articles, we'd love to hear from you! Please include a brief introduction and examples of your work when applying. Looking forward to collaborating with you!
title: Technical Content Writer for Articles on Tech Products and Software

description: As a remote UX QA tester, you will help test and validate user experience on various websites and games. Working from the comfort of your home, you'll interact with web platforms similar to how a regular user would, following specific instructions to understand customer loyalty programs and user flow. With this role, you'll be helping companies conduct competitive research, understand the market and common user issues, and see how companies' own current or future products stack up against the market. This is a short-term contractor role. We'll likely have additional projects and opportunities in the future as well. All applicants need to be US citizens, have their own computer, and be comfortable with remote work. Benefits: - Flexible working hours: Set your own schedule and work from the comfort of your home. Projects typically have capacity for up to 20-30 hours of work. - Competitive compensation: Some projects pay as much as $40 per hour (or more, depending on how quickly you complete your project) - Work-life balance: Balance work with your personal commitments by choosing the number of hours or projects that fit your schedule. If you have a passion for user experience and want to help us with website UX & QA, we want to hear from you. No previous UX testing experience required.
title: Remote Website and Games UX Tester

description: We're looking to partner with a number of performance marketing specialists who can do the following 2 things: 1.) Create lists of leads using Builtwith, Apollo.io, or Seamless.ai (or similar software) - specifically High Ticket Coaching Programs and High Ticket Info-Products (could be running on Kajabi) minimum $997 pricepoint 2.) Reach out to those leads and forward them to a landing page that we'll build for you with your own URL and Calendly embed for tracking. That's it! If anyone is open to a long term partnership.. this could be pretty easy work once we get it dialed in. Our product is awesome, people want it.. it's not hard to sell. We just need to automate the process of sourcing leads, getting our website in-front of them, and getting someone to book a call with me. Atomic Funnels dot com is our site. Attached is a pitch deck of our services. The compensation structure is open to negotiation, but we're happy to pay $1000 for a closed deal, or $100 for a booked call that someone actually attends.
title: Performance Marketing / Lead Gen For Funnel Agency

description: We are looking for a talented and motivated C# and .NET Back-End Developer to join our dynamic development team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in software development, a deep understanding of back-end technologies, and a passion for building robust and scalable applications. Key Responsibilities: Design, develop, and maintain back-end systems and APIs using C# and .NET technologies. Collaborate with front-end developers to integrate user-facing elements using server-side logic. Write clean, scalable, and efficient code while following best practices and coding standards. Optimize applications for maximum speed and scalability. Troubleshoot, debug applications, and conduct peer code reviews. Participate in the full software development life cycle, including requirements gathering, design, implementation, testing, and deployment. Stay up to date with emerging technologies and industry trends. Requirements: Proven experience as a Back-End Developer using C# and .NET. Strong understanding of database systems (SQL Server, MySQL, or similar). Experience with RESTful API design and development. Familiarity with cloud services (Azure, AWS) is a plus. Knowledge of version control systems (e.g., Git). Solid understanding of software development methodologies, such as Agile/Scrum. Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work both independently and as part of a team. Strong communication skills and a collaborative mindset. Preferred Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field. Experience with microservices architecture and containerization (Docker, Kubernetes). Familiarity with front-end technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript) is a plus.
title: C# and Dot Net Back-end Developer Needed

title: Excel Plugin Help

description: You must attach a resu me, We are seeking a highly skilled and customer-focused Technical Support Representative to join our dynamic remote team. In this pivotal role, you will provide exceptional technical assistance to our clients, ensuring smooth operation and satisfaction with our cutting-edge engineering solutions and software systems. You will be the first point of contact for technical inquiries, troubleshooting issues, and collaborating with internal teams to resolve challenges efficiently. Your contributions will directly influence our client relationships and help maintain Company reputation as a trusted partner in the engineering industry. What You'll Do Respond to client inquiries via email, phone, or chat, providing timely and accurate technical support for software and engineering solutions. Diagnose and troubleshoot technical issues related to our systems, offering step-by-step guidance or escalating when necessary. Collaborate with engineering and IT teams to resolve complex issues and implement long-term solutions. Maintain detailed records of client interactions, troubleshooting steps, and resolutions using our CRM and ticketing systems. Develop and update technical support documentation, FAQs, and user guides. Monitor system performance and proactively identify potential issues to minimize disruptions. Provide training and onboarding support to clients to enhance their understanding of our solutions. Stay updated on industry trends, software updates, and company products to deliver informed support.
title: Technical Support Representative

title: Experienced Accountant Needed for Financial Management

description: ONLY DEVELOPERS IN THE UNITED STATES. FLUENT OR NATIVE ENGLISH ONLY. STRONG COMMUNICATION SKILLS. We're seeking an experienced React developer to implement a pluggable UI layout system for LibreChat (https://github.com/danny-avila/LibreChat), an open-source chat application. The goal is to create a configuration-based UI system that allows users to customize layouts while maintaining the ability to pull upstream updates. Key Requirements: + Implement a UI layout configuration system that separates presentation from core logic + Create a plugin/theme system for hot-swappable layouts + Ensure compatibility with Microsoft Azure deployment + Maintain proper TypeScript typing throughout the implementation + Document the system thoroughly for future contributors Required Technical Skills: + 5+ years of React development experience + Strong TypeScript knowledge Experience with: + Next.js + Azure deployment and services + Node.js/Express + MongoDB + Docker + Git/GitHub workflow + Building plugin/theme systems + Writing technical documentation Deliverables: 1. Implementation of layout configuration system 2. Documentation for: + System architecture + How to create custom layouts + Deployment instructions 3. At least one alternative layout example 4. Unit tests for new components 5. Azure deployment configuration To Apply, Please Provide: + Your experience with similar plugin/theme systems + Examples of open-source contributions + Brief proposal on how you would approach this implementation + Estimated timeline for completion + Previous experience with Azure deployments + Link to your GitHub profile Questions to Answer in Your Proposal: + How would you handle backward compatibility? + What approach would you take to minimize merge conflicts for forked repositories? + How would you structure the configuration files? + What testing strategy would you implement? Project Timeline: 1-2 weeks Additional Notes: + Must be willing to sign appropriate contributor agreements + Must be comfortable with open-source development practices + Regular progress updates and communication required + Code must follow the project's existing standards and practices + Experience with AI/chat applications is a plus The ideal candidate will have demonstrable experience building modular React applications and a strong understanding of software architecture principles. They should be able to balance flexibility with maintainability in their design decisions. Please note that all code will be open source and must adhere to the project's licensing requirements. Candidates who understand the existing LibreChat codebase and can provide specific examples of how they would implement this feature while maintaining the project's current capabilities and performance will be given preference. ////////////////// IMPLEMENTATION PLAN \\\\\\\\\\\\\\ ++++ Milestone 1: Initial Setup and Architecture (3 Days) ++++ Deliverables: Project architecture documentation Configuration file structure design Basic plugin system infrastructure Development environment setup with TypeScript configuration Acceptance Criteria: Approved architecture documentation Working development environment with TypeScript Initial configuration system structure GitHub workflow integration Payment: 25% of total budget ++++ Milestone 2: Core Layout System Implementation (4 Days) ++++ Deliverables: Base layout component system Layout configuration parser Hot-swappable theme mechanism Initial unit tests Integration with existing LibreChat components Acceptance Criteria: Functioning layout switching capability Successful integration with existing codebase Passing unit tests No regression in existing functionality Payment: 30% of total budget ++++ Milestone 3: Alternative Layout and Documentation (4 Days) ++++ Deliverables: One complete alternative layout implementation Comprehensive documentation including: System architecture guide Custom layout creation guide Configuration file documentation Azure deployment instructions Additional unit tests and integration tests Acceptance Criteria: Working alternative layout Complete documentation approved by project maintainers All tests passing Successful local testing of layout switching Payment: 25% of total budget ++++ Milestone 4: Deployment and Final Integration (3 Days) ++++ Deliverables: Azure deployment configuration Production-ready code with optimizations Final testing results Pull request ready for review Video demonstration of the system Acceptance Criteria: Successful Azure deployment All features working in a development and production environment Approved pull request Documentation fully updated with deployment details Payment: 20% of total budget Additional Requirements Throughout All Milestones: Daily progress updates via the agreed communication channel Code review feedback implementation Regular commits with clear commit messages Adherence to existing code style and practices Maintaining backward compatibility Regular testing to ensure no regression ++++ Timeline Summary ++++ Total Duration: 14 days Milestone 1: Days 1-3 Milestone 2: Days 4-7 Milestone 3: Days 8-11 Milestone 4: Days 12-14
title: Senior React Developer - UI Layout Swap System for Open Source Chat App

description: About The Business: I own a power equipment dealership, and we have a niche selling top of the line pre-owned $6,000-$9,000/ea. commercial grade zero turn mowers. The bottleneck we are running into is it is just me that is able to Source inventory because there is no Kelly Blue Book, or NADA, for mowers and only I know the market because I've studied it, and specialized in only this for the past 4 years. This is a market that only I know, and need to be able to translate that knowledge to other employees to delegate this task, and allow us to scale further. PS: I know very little about software development. End Goal: I want to have a system built where an employee can plug in what kind of mower they are looking at purchasing for the dealership, it's given specs (Like: Make/Model/Deck Width/Hours/Engine Make/Engine HP, Cosmetic Condition Rating/Expected Problems...etc), and it tell them how much we can afford to pay for it. Please note, this does NOT need to be EXTREMELY sophisticated- I want to get a "prototype/beta" going first that only we use in house to purchase inventory within a reasonable budget, then re-fine further from there after its been used. I want to be very clear, we are not in the pursuit of creating a system that is a bandaid fix, we are wanting to compete at a high level, and are in the pursuit of excellence, and high talent. It MUST be a system that employees can interact with, that removes the risk of making a bad purchasing decision, that is easy to train someone on, and that can be easily scaled to more and more purchasing reps in the dealership.
title: Business Systems Developer

If you have a passion for storytelling through video, we would love to see your portfolio!
title: Video Editor Needed for Engaging Content Creation

description: Looking for a software tester to test various web and mobile applications. We do several projects throughout the year, and only need help for testing every other month or so, so for this job posting, we're looking for the right person that we can reach out to when we have a testing need, and they can step in, learn the product, and work with the dev team to get the testing done and the product validated. Typical workflow: 1. Read product documentation for new features/changes/other specs 2. Meet with Product Owner to discuss motivations, specs, answer questions, etc. 3. When dev team delivers a product, test it against specs, common sense, etc. 4. Document any usability issues, bugs, typo's, etc. 5. Wait for dev team to fix everything reported 6. Repeat steps 3-5 until product meets specifications 80% of the time, the product will just require using a website, entering information, manipulating information, etc. 20% of the time more complicated testing will be required such as using tools like Postman to generate web requests against an API. To do this, you should understand how web requests work, the basics of web authentication (e.g. OAuth, JWT, etc.), and also be able to work with SQL and document databases to perform basic queries.
title: Software Tester

description: We are seeking a skilled Real Estate Transaction Coordinator to manage the end-to-end process of real estate transactions. We are a multi-state real estate company with 4 offices and growing. The ideal candidate will ensure all documentation is completed accurately and timely, coordinate with buyers, sellers, and agents, and maintain communication throughout the process. Strong organizational skills and attention to detail are essential. Familiarity with real estate software and regulations is a plus. If you are proactive and possess excellent customer service skills, we want to hear from you! Please note this position is part-time, but full-time hours are available based on experience for the right candidate.
title: Real Estate Transaction Coordinator Needed

description: ABOUT US We are a growing personal injury law firm that handles motor vehicle accidents. Managing our caseload efficiently is critical, as we need to track case progress through various stages in our pipeline and stay on top of numerous tasks for each case. PROJECT SCOPE Help us decide on a project management software (Airtable, Asana, ClickUp, Monday, etc.) We are seeking a project management expert to help us design and implement a customized project management workflow tailored to the needs of a law firm. This will involve: Setting up a system that allows us to track cases as they move through intake, treatment, demand, and resolution stages. Creating task management tools to assign, monitor, and streamline work for multiple team members. QUALIFICATIONS Extensive experience with Monday.com setup, customization, and integrations. Ability to handle data migration and synchronization from external systems. Proven track record of creating workflows for service-based businesses, preferably law firms or similar industries. WHO SHOULD APPLY If you can help us build a robust and intuitive workflow, we look forward to hearing from you.
title: Project Management Expert Needed for Implementing New Workflow

title: Support for client on Raiser's Edge to understand workflow capabilities.

description: We are seeking an experienced Ruby developer to conduct a comprehensive audit of our current project. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of Ruby on Rails, code optimization techniques, and best practices in software development. Your role will involve reviewing the existing codebase, identifying potential issues, and providing actionable recommendations for improvement. If you are passionate about quality code and have a keen eye for detail, we would love to hear from you.
title: Ruby Developer Needed for Project Audit

description: We are seeking an experienced IT consultant to support our growing CPA firm. The ideal candidate will have at least 15 years of experience in the IT field and possess strong problem-solving and technical skills. Timeline: • Work Hours: Flexible; this project will progress through three phases. • Start Date: January 6, 2025 Scope of Work: Phase 1: Assessment Provide a written proposal to address the current IT environment’s needs and concerns, along with the tasks outlined in the Responsibilities section. The proposal should include the costs and timeline for implementing the changes. Phase 2: Implementation Execute the goals and objectives outlined in Phase 1 and complete all tasks within the agreed-upon timeline. Phase 3: Periodic Review Conduct quarterly reviews of the changes made to the IT environment. Evaluate and implement solutions for emerging needs. Concerns: 1. Secured Cloud Storage: Design the framework and structure for storing client documents and files on secure cloud platforms, enhancing accessibility and collaboration. 2. Access Controls: Implement role-based access to control who can view or edit specific types of data, ensuring the prevention of unauthorized access. 3. Risk Assessment: Identify potential IT risks and vulnerabilities and develop a disaster recovery plan to ensure business continuity in case of an emergency. 4. Backup and Disaster Recovery: Set up automated backup systems to ensure data security in the event of hardware failure or data loss. 5. Regulatory Compliance: Ensure the firm’s IT practices comply with relevant industry standards and regulations. 6. Other Concerns: Assessment and potential implementation of Intrusion Detection & Virus Protection software, Firewall and/or VPNs. Qualifications: • Technical Skills: A minimum of 15 years of experience providing IT services to growing companies. • Communication Skills: Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
title: Experienced IT Consultant for a Growing CPA Firm

description: We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Interaction Designer to join our team. The ideal candidate will be a self-starter, fast worker and excited about growing a company from the ground up. Dedicated product design is a new role at FusionAuth! This is a great opportunity to bring your expertise to help shape the future of interactive design and feature validation. This role will report to the VP of Product Delivery while working with our Digital Creative Director. Responsibilities Include: • Collaborate iteratively with product managers and engineers to validate and implement new ideas • Build high-fidelity, interactive prototypes to communicate ideas and test them with users • Work in an agile mode, rapidly testing and evolving designs through the product discovery phase • User Interface (UI) Design: Create visually appealing and user-friendly interfaces that align with our brand guidelines. • Build and maintain an interaction style guide that we will leverage to maintain UX consistency across our various applications • Design intuitive and engaging interactions for authentication flows, including login, registration, and password recovery. Qualifications: • pro10+ years of browser-based application and interaction design • Experience with mobile interaction design • Experience participating in user and usability testing • Experience writing software. Our users are most often developers, and we believe that success in this role requires a high level of empathy for the developer • Strong portfolio demonstrating exceptional design skills and problem-solving abilities • Excellent communication and collaboration skills • Ability to work independently and as part of a team • Proficiency in design tools such as Sketch, or similar (Sketch is a plus) About You: • You have deep empathy for the user, and strive to provide the design the delivers value in the most effortless way possible • You have strong opinions about interactive design, but they are loosely held. You realize there are not always one-size-fits-all solutions. • You’re a creative thinker, and can propose novel solutions to complicated usability problems • You are able to work iteratively in a fail-fast manner
title: Product UI/UX Interactive Designer

description: Job Title: High Ticket Sales Associate Location: Remote Job Type: Full-time Position Overview: We are seeking a driven and persuasive High Ticket Sales Associate to join our dynamic sales team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for selling high-value products/services, developing strong relationships with clients, and achieving sales targets. This position requires excellent communication skills, a deep understanding of customer needs, and the ability to close deals effectively. Key Responsibilities: - Engage with potential clients through various channels (phone, email, social media). - Understand client needs and tailor solutions to meet their specific requirements. - Develop and maintain strong relationships with high-value clients. - Conduct product presentations and demonstrations, showcasing the value and benefits of the offerings. - Handle objections and negotiate effectively to close sales. - Follow up with leads and nurture client relationships to encourage repeat business. - Achieve and exceed sales targets and performance metrics. - Maintain accurate records of sales activities and client interactions in the CRM system. - Collaborate with the marketing team to develop strategies for lead generation and brand promotion. Qualifications: - Proven experience in high-ticket sales, preferably in [specify industry, e.g., real estate, luxury goods, financial services]. - Strong understanding of the sales process, from prospecting to closing. - Excellent communication, interpersonal, and negotiation skills. - Ability to build rapport and trust with clients quickly. - Self-motivated with a results-oriented attitude. - Proficient in using CRM software and other sales tools. - Bachelor's degree in Business, Marketing, or a related field is preferred but not required. Benefits: - Competitive salary plus commission structure. - Weekends are optional - Opportunities for professional development and career advancement.
title: High-ticket Sales Associate

description: Cerebral Tax Advisors is a Tax Preparation agency specializing in helping high net work individuals maximize their tax returns. This fully remote team serves over 150 clients every day. About the Role: We are seeking a highly organized and detail-oriented Operations Assistant to join our growing team. In this remote role, you will play a crucial part in ensuring the smooth and efficient operation of our day-to-day activities. This position requires strong communication skills, a proactive approach, and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment. Responsibilities: Data Entry: Accurately input data into various systems and databases. System Updates: Maintain and update information across different platforms. Template Management: Update and improve existing templates to enhance efficiency. SOP Creation & Maintenance: Develop and maintain comprehensive Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) for various processes. Process Improvement: Identify opportunities to streamline operations and improve workflows. Communication: Provide regular updates on progress and proactively communicate any challenges or roadblocks. Qualifications: US-Based: Must be located within the United States. Excellent Communication Skills: Able to clearly and effectively communicate both verbally and in writing. Strong Attention to Detail: Highly accurate and meticulous in data entry and documentation. Proficiency in GSuite of Products: Specifically Gmail, Gchat, Google Docs, and Google Sheets. Tech Savvy: Comfortable learning and adapting to new software and systems. Self-Starter: Able to work independently and manage time effectively in a remote environment. Overcommunication: Proactive in providing updates and seeking clarification when needed. Reliable and Dedicated: Committed to meeting deadlines and producing high-quality work.
title: Operations Assistant - Data Entry & Systems Maintenance

description: I'm looking for a male voiceover artist to record ~1:15 of audio for a corporate video that shows how a new technology works. I need a confident and articulate voice. Here is the transcript for the video: ===================== Avalon's technology is a proprietary software platform for automating factories and manufacturing processes. Combined with robotics, vision, sensors, and AI, the software actively manages the factory and its equipment, integrating everything into one seamless flow. We call our software the Manufacturing Operating System, or M-O-S for short. Here is one example of how Avalon helps manufacturers achieve end-to-end automation. The M-O-S uses computer vision to find the correct piece of raw material. The robot grabs the raw material and places it into the C-N-C machine. With safety checks complete, the M-O-S then remotely starts the CNC machine. Any number of machines can be integrated into the M-O-S for concurrent production. When the CNC machine cycle is complete, the part is cleaned, marked with a laser, inspected with AI vision, and measured by the Coordinate Measurement Machine. Dozens of sensors and cameras throughout the process give the M-O-S feedback that allows it to monitor, manage and optimize every aspect of production. This is just one example of the infinite possibilities of how the Manufacturing Operating System can be rapidly deployed to build fully automation manufacturing. Partner with Avalon to unlock the potential of your manufacturing.
title: Male Voiceover Artist Needed

description: About Valiant: ‎ ‎ Valiant is a full-service content creation and digital marketing agency for service businesses in the trading, reselling, sports betting, and e-commerce niches. Our clients include some of the largest companies in the online side-hustle niche including Whop.com, one of the largest digital marketplace in the world. Our current offerings include short-form video creation, email marketing, and paid advertising, among others. Over the next 12 months we have plans to expand and as a result are looking to hire additional marketing staff in our paid ads, social media, and email marketing teams. Our vision is to be the go-to marketing agency for all types of services that help people make money online. We are already very well known in the sports betting and reselling niches however are looking to venture much further into niches we’re less known in and build a market-wide reputation for ruthlessly outperforming other marketers in the space. Compensation & Perks: 💸 $5,000 monthly starting salary. 📈 Up to $10k in monthly salary based on initial 90-day performance. 🌎 Full-time remote-based position with flexible working hours. ✈️ Flights, US visa sponsorship, and accommodation for team meetups. Job Responsibilities: – Handling all of the following social media management-related responsibilities. – Video scripting, storyboarding, and content planning for each unique piece of content for all clients. – Communicating with clients multiple times per day to provide updates, conversate, and answer questions. – Coordinating and managing our video editing team to ensure we maintain expectations and get clients results. – Hosting and organizing weekly catch-up meetings and monthly performance recaps with all clients using our social media marketing services. – Hosting and organizing daily stand-up meetings and weekly performance reviews with all relevant social media marketing staff. – Occasional video editing or video revisions where necessary. Required Qualifications: – 3+ years experience with creating, scripting, or editing social media content and experience communicating with clients. – Must be a resident of the US, UK, Canada, Europe, Australia, or New Zealand. – Willing to commit to working full-time exclusively for our company (cannot be in school, running your own business, or working other jobs). – Experience creating content for at least 1 of the following social media channels: Instagram Reels, TikTok, YouTube, or YouTube Shorts. – A deep understanding of what creatives will generate engagement (views, likes, comments, etc) and ultimately website traffic on social media, especially on TikTok, Instagram Reels, and YouTube Shorts. – Proven track record of getting companies’ social media engagement and growing pages on Instagram, YouTube, TikTok, X, and other social media platforms. – A deep understanding of how social media algorithms work and how to increase viewer retention. – Must be fluent in English and capable of writing or adjusting scripts, captions, etc. Nice To Have Qualifications: – Experience with any of the following editing softwares: Adobe Premiere Pro, DaVanci Resolve, Final Cut Pro, or other video editing tools. – Experience with motion graphics and animation tools such as Adobe After Effects, Blender, and Cinema 4D. – Experience with audio editing software (Adobe Audition, Audacity, etc). – Experience with image editing and graphic design tools (Adobe Photoshop, Adobe Illustrator, Canva, etc). – Experience with scripting and storyboarding tools including Final Draft, Celtx, StoryBoard That, and other similar tools. – Experience with social media management and analytics tools such as Loomly, Buffer, Hootsuite, and Sprout Social. – Experience with stock footage and music libraries, or any experience with finding clips / footage to use in videos. – Previous experience starting a business or experience working at smaller companies/startups. – Bachelors or Masters in digital marketing, consumer behavior, public relations, or equivalent experience. – Knowledge, or interest in sports betting, trading, reselling, or e-commerce. – Based in Florida or willing to travel to Miami from time to time to meet up with other members of the team. Who We Need: – You’ve got positive energy. You’re optimistic about the future and determined to get there. – You are looking for an exciting opportunity that isn’t just about the money. – You’re comfortable with agile workflow and are quick to iterate. – You work well with direct, rapid, and candid feedback. – You’re both an active communicator and an eager listener. – You’re passionate about social media marketing and have high standards. – You are willing to take 100% responsibility for your team’s performance. – You’re willing to go outside of your comfort zone and you’re up for new challenges. – You are a very hard-working and driven person, and are flexible with your work days/hours. – You have a winners mindset. You want to win and you’re not satisfied with the status quo. – You are comfortable with startup culture. It’s casual, and not corporate, but is demanding.
title: Social Media Account Manager

description: We are seeking a talented and creative video editor to produce a polished 30-second video showcasing our office and showroom. The video will highlight our extensive line of pet supplies, including dog beds, dog toys, cat products, and more. The goal is to create a visually engaging and professional video that can be shared by our sales team with potential buyers. Responsibilities: Edit raw footage of our office and showroom to create a professional 30-second presentation video. Highlight key products such as dog beds, dog toys, and cat supplies in an engaging manner. Add smooth transitions, music, text overlays, and any other elements needed to enhance the video. Ensure the final video is visually appealing and suitable for use in sales communications. Collaborate with our team to incorporate feedback and ensure the video aligns with our brand identity. Requirements: Proven experience in video editing (please provide a portfolio or examples of previous work). Proficiency in video editing software such as Adobe Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro, or similar tools. Strong attention to detail and ability to meet tight deadlines. Creative mindset with the ability to make products look appealing and engaging. Excellent communication skills to understand project requirements and incorporate feedback effectively. Preferred Qualifications: Experience editing videos for retail or e-commerce businesses. Familiarity with showcasing products in a way that appeals to buyers. To Apply: Please send your resume, a brief description of your experience, and a link to your portfolio or relevant work samples to [your email address]. Include "Showroom Video Editor Application" in the subject line.
title: European Home Show Room

description: Job Title: WebFlow Developer (Contract, Remote) Job Overview: We are seeking a talented and experienced WebFlow Developer to join our team on a contract basis. The ideal candidate will design, optimize, and maintain our WebFlow-based website to ensure it meets business goals and delivers an outstanding user experience. Key Responsibilities: * Develop, customize, and optimize websites using WebFlow. * Integrate content, media, and interactive elements to create engaging user experiences. * Work closely with the SEO team to implement best practices, optimize links, and improve search engine rankings. * Ensure the website is responsive, fast-loading, and accessible across all devices. Perform ongoing maintenance, updates, and troubleshooting to ensure website functionality. Provide monthly support and enhancements as needed. Qualifications: * 1+ years of proven experience as a WebFlow Developer. * Proficiency in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. * Strong experience in website technical performance. * Strong understanding of web design principles and UX/UI best practices. * Experience with SEO strategies and tools. * Excellent attention to detail and problem-solving skills. * Strong communication skills, with the ability to work collaboratively in a team environment. Preferred Skills: * Familiarity with Google Analytics and other analytics tools. * Experience with graphic design software such as Adobe Creative Suite. * Background in digital marketing or working with cross-functional teams.
title: Webflow Website Designer for Monthly Support

title: Website, redesign, and optimization

description: Job Description: Anesthesia Coding Professional Position: Anesthesia Coding Professional Department: Revenue Cycle Management Location: Remote Employment Type: Sub-Contractor About the Role: We are seeking a detail-oriented and experienced Anesthesia Coding Professional to join our team. This role is critical in ensuring accurate and efficient coding of anesthesia services, enabling timely claims submission and optimal reimbursement. The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of anesthesia-specific coding guidelines, compliance requirements, and documentation standards. Key Responsibilities: Medical Coding: Review and assign accurate CPT, ASA, ICD-10, and HCPCS codes for anesthesia services based on medical documentation. Compliance: Ensure coding practices align with federal, state, and payer-specific regulations, including HIPAA and CMS guidelines. Documentation Review: Analyze provider documentation to ensure completeness and accuracy; communicate with providers for clarification when necessary. Claims Management: Collaborate with billing teams to ensure claims are submitted with the appropriate codes and modifiers to minimize denials and maximize reimbursement. Audit and Quality Assurance: Participate in coding audits to identify and correct errors, and implement improvements to maintain high standards of accuracy. Education and Training: Stay current with changes in coding standards, payer requirements, and industry trends; share knowledge with team members and providers as needed. Data Analysis: Track coding-related metrics to identify trends, improve workflows, and enhance overall revenue cycle efficiency. Qualifications: Certified Professional Coder (CPC), Certified Coding Specialist (CCS), or Certified Anesthesia and Pain Management Coder (CANPC) certification. Minimum of [Insert Years] years of experience in anesthesia coding or a similar role. Comprehensive knowledge of CPT, ASA, ICD-10-CM, and HCPCS coding systems specific to anesthesia and pain management. Familiarity with medical terminology, anatomy, and physiology relevant to anesthesia. Proficiency in electronic health record (EHR) systems and coding software. Strong understanding of payer-specific policies, including Medicare and commercial insurers. Excellent analytical skills and attention to detail. Effective communication and interpersonal skills for collaborating with providers and team members. Preferred Qualifications: Background in revenue cycle management for anesthesia practices. Knowledge of concurrent anesthesia documentation (e.g., concurrency, time reporting).
title: Anesthesia Coding Professional

description: Job Title: Virtual Assistant – Real Estate Wholesaling Location: Remote Job Type: Part-time About Us: We are a dynamic real estate investment firm specializing in wholesaling. Our team is looking for a highly motivated and organized Virtual Assistant. Job Description: As a Virtual Assistant, you will be responsible for providing administrative and operational support to the team, primarily focusing on real estate wholesaling tasks. Cold-calling, negotiating deals, and assisting with the acquisition process. This position requires a proactive, results-driven individual who thrives in a fast-paced environment. Responsibilities: Lead Generation: Research and identify potential motivated sellers using various online tools, databases, and platforms. Cold Calling: Conduct outbound calls to property owners, gauging interest in selling properties, and gathering key information. Deal Negotiation: Engage in direct communication with property owners to negotiate deals, including pricing and contract terms, ensuring favorable outcomes for the company. Acquisition Support: Assist with the acquisition process by ensuring all paperwork is completed and contracts are signed. CRM Management: Maintain and update our customer relationship management (CRM) system with leads, contacts, and property details. Market Research: Conduct market analysis and assess property values to ensure proper valuation and successful deal closures. Administrative Support: Provide additional administrative support as needed, such as scheduling calls, managing calendars, and organizing paperwork. Qualifications: Fluent in English: Strong verbal and written communication skills. Experience in Real Estate Wholesaling: A solid understanding of the real estate industry, particularly wholesaling, including lead generation, acquisition, and deal negotiation. Excellent Negotiation Skills: Proven ability to negotiate effectively and professionally over the phone. Strong Organizational Skills: Ability to manage multiple tasks and deadlines efficiently. Tech-Savvy: Comfortable using CRM systems, Microsoft Office, Google Workspace, and other real estate software tools. Self-Motivated: Ability to work independently and stay focused in a remote work environment. Detail-Oriented: Attention to detail is critical when dealing with contracts, property details, and lead management.
title: Real Estate Virtual Assistant

We are willing to offer 140 for each website project. Skill Requirements: • Excellent overall writing skills in a number of different styles/tones • Impeccable spelling and grammar • A deep understanding of consumers and what motivates them online • Great research, organization, and learning skills • High comprehension of software like Microsoft Word and Google Docs • Familiarity with keyword placement and other SEO best practices • Some experience with online marketing and lead generation Other Relevant/ Beneficial work Experience: • Blogs and new articles • Social media posts • Content for banners • Case studies, whitepapers
